title: ASAS Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis (SpA)
desc: The ASAS Criteria for Axial Spondyloarthritis (SpA) diagnoses axial spondyloarthritis according to Assessment of Spondyloarthritis International Society (ASAS) criteria.

orgreference.text: Rudwaleit M, Van Der Heijde D, Landewé R, et al. The development of Assessment of SpondyloArthritis international Society classification criteria for axial spondyloarthritis (part II): validation and final selection. Ann Rheum Dis. 2009;68(6):777-83.

other_refer.text: Van Der Linden S, Valkenburg HA, Cats A. Evaluation of diagnostic criteria for ankylosing spondylitis. A proposal for modification of the New York criteria. Arthritis Rheum. 1984;27(4):361-8.

data.evidence:
Entry criterion:

Back pain ≥3 months and age at onset <45 years

Required criteria:

Sacroiliitis on imaging* plus ≥1 SpA feature, or

HLA-B27 plus ≥2 additional SpA features

SpA features:

  • Inflammatory back pain
  • Arthritis
  • Enthesitis (heel)
  • Uveitis
  • Dactylitis
  • Psoriasis
  • Crohn’s disease or ulcerative colitis
  • Good response to NSAIDs
  • Family history of SpA
  • HLA-B27
  • Elevated CRP

*Active (acute) inflammation on MRI highly suggestive of SpA-associated sacroiliitis, or definite radiographic sacroiliitis according to modified New York criteria (bilateral grade 2-4 sacroiliitis or unilateral grade 3-4 sacroiliitis, Van Der Linden 1984).

inputs.label_en: Back pain ≥3 months and age at onset <45 years
inputs.name: backpain

inputs.label_en: Nucleii cu mai multe locuri și/sau celulele cu spindare sunt frecvent ciudate.
inputs.name: required
inputs.tips_en: Sacroiliitis on imaging = active (acute) inflammation on MRI highly suggestive of SpA-associated sacroiliitis, or definite radiographic sacroiliitis according to modified New York criteria

inputs.subheading_instructions: ?1 required if sacroiliitis on imaging; ?2 features other than HLA-B27 if HLA-B27 positive

inputs.name: ibp
inputs.tips_en: At least 4/5 present: (1) age at onset <40 years, (2) insidious onset, (3) improvement with exercise, (4) no improvement with rest, (5) pain at night with improvement upon getting up

inputs.name: arthritis
inputs.tips_en: Past or present active synovitis (peripheral) diagnosed by a physician

inputs.name: enthesitis
inputs.tips_en: Past or present spontaneous pain or tenderness at Achilles insertion or plantar fascia at calcaneus

inputs.name: uveitis
inputs.tips_en: Past or present uveitis anterior, confirmed by an ophthalmologist

inputs.name: dactylitis
inputs.tips_en: Past or present, diagnosed by a physician

inputs.name: psoriasis
inputs.tips_en: Past or present, diagnosed by a physician

inputs.name: nsaids
inputs.tips_en: Resolution or improvement of back pain 24–48 hrs after full dose of NSAID

inputs.name: famhx
inputs.tips_en: Presence in 1st- or 2nd-degree relatives of any of the following: (1) ankylosing spondylitis, (2) psoriasis, (3) acute uveitis, (4) reactive arthritis, (5) IBD

inputs.name: crp
inputs.tips_en: After exclusion of other causes for elevated CRP
